title: How to Make Butternut Squash Baby Food

steps.headline: Buy butternut from a local grocery store.
Remove the skin of the butternut with a sharp knife.
Remove the pips from the butternut.
Blend the butternut squash in a food processor.
steps.description: You can complete this step manually using a potato masher or fork if you do not own a blender or food processor.

steps.headline: Add half a teaspoon of Vegemite to the pureed butternut squash.
Boil glass baby food bottles and lids to sterilize them.
Remove bottles with a pair of tongs from boiling water.
Place butternut into jars and seal.
Place bottled butternut squash into the freezer.
For younger babies, freeze smaller portions of butternut squash puree in ice trays.
Once your baby is accustomed to the taste and texture of butternut, slowly start adding additional vegetables and even fruit to the butternut squash base.

text: Buy butternut from a local grocery store.  Boil or steam the butternut.  Allow the butternut to cool.  Remove the skin of the butternut with a sharp knife.  Remove the pips from the butternut.  Blend the butternut squash in a food processor. You can complete this step manually using a potato masher or fork if you do not own a blender or food processor. Add half a teaspoon of Vegemite to the pureed butternut squash.  Boil glass baby food bottles and lids to sterilize them.  Remove bottles with a pair of tongs from boiling water.  Place butternut into jars and seal.  Allow jars to cool.  Place bottled butternut squash into the freezer. Remove and thaw as needed. For younger babies, freeze smaller portions of butternut squash puree in ice trays.  Once your baby is accustomed to the taste and texture of butternut, slowly start adding additional vegetables and even fruit to the butternut squash base.
